verses.verse: A reed, sort of like a measuring stick, was given to me, and the angel stood saying, "Get up and measure the temple of God, the altar, and the worshipers in it.
"But leave out the courtyard outside the temple and do not measure it, because it is given to the Gentiles, and they will trample the holy city for forty-two months.
"And I will give authority to my two witnesses, and they will prophesy one thousand two hundred sixty days dressed in sackcloth.
"These are the two olive trees and two candlesticks standing in the presence of the God of the earth.
"If anyone wants to trouble them, fire will come out of their mouth and eat up their enemies. If anyone wants to trouble them, he must in this way be killed.

"These have authority to shut heaven, so that it does not rain during the time of their prophecy, and they have authority over water to turn it to blood and to smite the earth with all kinds of plagues as often as they want.
"When they have completed their testimony, the beast that comes up out of the bottomless pit will make war against them, overcome them, and kill them.
"Their dead bodies will lie in the street of the great city, which spiritually is called "Sodom" and "Egypt", where also our Lord was crucified.
"Those of the peoples, tribes, languages, and nations will see their dead bodies for three and a half days, and they will not allow their dead bodies to be put in graves.
"Those who live on the earth will rejoice over [what happened to] them. They will be ecstatic and send gifts to one another, because those two prophets tormented those who lived on the earth.
"After three and a half days, the Spirit of life from God entered them, then they stood upon their feet and great fear fell on those who saw them.
"Then they heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, «Come up here,» and they went up to heaven in a cloud, while their enemies watched them.
"That very hour there was a great earthquake, and one tenth of the city fell. In the earthquake seven thousand people died, and the rest were afraid and gave glory to the God of heaven.
"The second horror is over; look, the third horror comes quickly."
Then the seventh angel blew his trumpet, and there were loud voices in heaven saying, "The kingdoms of this world are now our Lord's and his Christ. He will reign forever and ever."
The twenty-four elders who sit in God's presence, dropped on their faces and worshipped God,
saying, "We give thanks, O Lord God Almighty, who is and was and is to come, because you have taken your great authority and started to reign.

"The nations were enraged, but your anger has come, and the time for the dead to be judged and to give reward to your servants, the prophets, God's people, and those who fear you name, both small and great, and to destroy those who are destroying the earth."
Then God's temple in heaven was opened, and there in his temple was seen the ark of his covenant, and there were lightnings, noises, thunderings, earthquake, and great hail.
